Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2012 09:24AM fpdgirl wrote: We all completely understand your fear.  Fortunately (or unfortunately, depending on how you view it) my doctor was able to tell me my tumor was breast cancer immediately after the biopsy.  I told him I wanted him to call me as soon as he received the report and he said, "I can tell you right now, it is cancer."  He said he didn't want me to get the news driving down the highway or in a crowded meeting.  I appreciated that.  My husband was angry, thinking the doctor could be wrong, but I don't believe he would have said it if he hadn't been sure.  Believe it or not, finally knowing for sure gave me the strength to get to the next step in the process.  This is a wonderful place for help and advice.  I ONLY come to the site for advice.  Randomly wandering the internet is frightening and you will find a lot of misleading information!  Good luck.
